entries.name: Age
entries: Flameveil reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century. Flameveils who merge with an elemental can live upwards of 300 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Flameveil society, with its clear devotion to their deity, has a strong lawful bent. Because of their isolation, they tend to lean more toward neutral.

entries.name: Size
entries: Flameveil take the shape of humans, and as such, they vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Candle in the Dark
entries: You appear to be surrounded by a soft flickering candlelight that extends outwards 30 feet in all directions. As a bonus action, you can smother your flames and cause them to dim. Dimming your flames this way causes no visible light emit from your body, although up-close inspection will still reveal a faint flickering light.

entries.name: Heritage of the Flameveil
entries: You were born to the Eternal Hearth, the Planet Blessed by Kurmok. As a flameveil, you are composed of both his will and his desire—yet the flameveil were never a warlike race. On the contrary, they often fought defensively, protecting their land from clans such as the firenewt tribes and elementals which roamed their homeworld. As a child of Kurmok, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have two creature types: humanoid and elemental. You can be affected by a spell or ability that works on either of your creature types.

The first time you would be subjected to fire damage, you treat that attack as if you had immunity. Afterwards, your immunity transforms into resistance. This temporary immunity resets on a short or long rest.
You learn the {@spell control flames} and {@spell produce flame} cantrips. Charisma is your spellcasting modifier for these spells.
For many millennia, your people have done battle with elementals, and you know their tricks. You have advantage on Constitution and Dexterity saving throws made to avoid or resist fire.

entries.name: Body of Flame
entries: While you appear humanoid on the offset, your true form is composed of extremely-dense fire which can be easily morphed into the visage of a human. That form can easily be dropped at a moment's notice, although it requires a decent bit of stamina to perform.

When you would be subject to a melee or ranged weapon attack, you can roll a Dexterity or Charisma saving throw (your choice) as a reaction with a DC equal to 8 + the creature's to-hit modifier. On a successful save, the attack misses. You can use this feature twice, and regain all expended uses on a long rest.

entries.name: Final Light
entries: Starting at 2nd level, upon reaching zero hit points, your body becomes one with Kurmok, and you explode into a fiery storm. Each hostile creature in a 30 feet radius must make a Dexterity saving throw equal to your 8 + your Charisma modifier + your proficiency bonus. On a failed save, they take {@dice 1d8} fire damage. For every two levels above 2, add an additional {@dice 1d8} fire damage. On a successful save, they instead take half damage. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Ignan.

entries.name: Age
entries: Firenewts reach adulthood at age five, but have been known to live up to 50 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Firenewts worship Imix, the Prince of Evil Fire. A religion which permeates their very being, causing them to revel in evil acts across the Plane of Fire. Firenewt society has few rules, although they are more regimented than a goblin horde or an orc tribe. They are thus usually more neutral rather than lawful or chaotic.

entries.name: Size
entries: A firenewt stands at roughly 6 feet tall (about a third of which being their necks), and maintain narrow, extremely tubular torsos. They are, without doubt, the sexiest creatures on Kagrea. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Amphibious?
entries: You can breathe in smoke, air, and water. In addition, you can ingest lava and other flammable liquids.

entries.name: Spit Fire
entries: As a bonus action, you can spit a molt of fire at a creature within 10 feet of you. That creature must make a Dexterity saving throw equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier. On a failed save, that creature takes {@dice 1d8} fire damage, or half as much on a successful one. The fire damage increases to 2d8 at 5th level. 3d8 at 10th level, 4d8 at 15th level, and 5d8 at 20th level. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Lizard of Flames
entries: You have resistance to fire damage, and do not take any damage from being immersed in lava or other hot liquids. In addition, you do not suffer any ill effects from extreme heat.

entries.name: Conventional Weaponry
entries: You gain proficiency in scimitars.

entries.name: Touched by the Fire Lord
entries: As an action, you immerse yourself in the rage of Imix, the Prince of Evil Fire. For the next minute, whenever you take slashing or piercing damage from a creature within 5 feet of you, that creature takes {@dice 1d6} fire damage. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Ignan, and Draconic.

entries.name: Age
entries: Although you have severed yourself from the connecting strand of power which once bound you to the Devil's Palace, your body has irreputably changed from its fiendish energies. Succubus & Incubus mature at the same rate as humans, but they live for much longer, often exceeding 450 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: While the binding strand between you and the Devil's Palace has been cut, you have been transformed into a otherworldly beast with a fiendish nature, and that kind of psychological conditioning does not fade easily. Most succubus & incubus who separate themselves from the Devil's Palace remain both neutral and evil, until their future growth (unhindered by their fiendish connection) allows them to mature and develop their own idealisms.

entries.name: Size
entries: While you are not human, your form has been designed after their own. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Foundation in Archaism
entries: Your creature type is fiend, rather than humanoid.

entries.name: Attuned Flight
entries: You have a flying speed of 30 feet. To use this speed, you must attune to the Way of Worlds by act of sacrificing an attunement slot. Attuning to flight takes the same amount of time and follows the same restrictions as attuning to a magic item.

entries.name: The Wile of a Demon
entries: You have advantage on any check or saving throw made to seduce a target, regardless of whether that target is {@condition charmed} by you. If that creature does happen to be charmed by you, you can reroll one of the dice once.

entries.name: Shapetaker
entries: Your loss of connection to the Devil's Palace has siphoned away your ability to shapeshift, but you still retain some of your former finesse. You gain proficiency in {@skill Deception} skill.

In addition to this, as an action, you can dematerialize your wings, horns, and other devilish appendages, absorbing their matter and spreading it throughout your body. While you are disguising your devilish features this way, any attempt to discern your creature type will cause you to ping as humanoid, rather than fiend.
This ability is not considered to be an illusion, and is unaffected by spells such as {@spell dispel magic}.

entries.name: Alluring Telepathy
entries: You can speak telepathically to any humanoid creature you have {@condition charmed}, regardless of distance. You and your {@condition charmed} target need not even share the same plane of existence.
You don't need to share a language with the creature for it to understand your telepathic utterances, but the creature must be able to understand at least one language.

entries.name: Devil's Palace
entries: As an action, you can target one humanoid creature within 30 feet of you. That creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier. On a failed save, that creature becomes {@condition charmed} by you for one minute.

If your target suffers any harm (other than being damaged by your Draining Kiss), the effect immediately ends, and that creature is no longer charmed. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Draining Kiss
entries: As an reaction upon first charming a creature with Devil's Palace, and as a bonus action thereafter, you kiss a creature {@condition charmed} by you or a willing creature within 5 feet of you. That target must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier.

On a failed save, that target takes {@dice 2d6} psychic damage, and you heal for amount equal to half the damage taken (rounded down). The psychic damage increases to 3d6 at 5th level. 4d6 at 10th level, 5d6 at 15th level, and 6d6 at 20th level.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and regain all expended uses on a long rest.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Infernal, and Abyssal.

entries.name: Age
entries: With infrequent replacement to their parts and general upkeep on their bodies, puppets can conceivably exist indefinitely. Puppets are known to degrade and lose their sentience, however, if they live too long without an explicit purpose.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Puppets, having been created artifically and completely detached from human idealisms, tend to be neutral in all aspects.

entries.name: Size
entries: While you are not human, your form has been designed after their own. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Inanimate
entries: Your creature type is construct, rather than humanoid. In addition, while you remain motionless, you are indistinguishable from an ordinary puppet. Finally, you gain access to the following benefits as per your puppet nature:

items: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}, and you have resistance to force and poison damage.
You are immune to disease.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe, and can survive in a vacuum.
You don't need to sleep and don't suffer the effects of {@condition exhaustion} due to lack of rest, and magic can't put you to sleep.
When you regain hit points from a source that specifies it does not function on constructs, you instead receive half as many hit points as the source would provide, rounded down, instead of none.

entries.name: Glass Eyes
entries: As a bonus action, you tap into the senses of your marionettes, perceiving the world around you from an neigh omnipresent position. You gain {@sense blindsight} out to a range of 30 feet for one minute. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Occupied
entries: You are immune to the movement portion of spells and effects which would force you to move against your will, and creatures cannot read your thoughts, determine whether you are lying, know your alignment, or telepathically communicate with you unless you allow it. Finally, you have advantage on saving throws to avoid being {@condition charmed}.

entries.name: Framed
entries: Whenever you take fire damage, you take additional damage equal to 5 - your Constitution modifier. This damage cannot be reduced or ignored by resistance or immunity.

entries.name: Danse Macabre
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. If you do so, you fall into a heap of limbs and string and render yourself {@condition prone}. You are considered to be under similar effects to the {@spell feign death} spell. While subject to this condition, you are unable to move or take actions other than using an action to end this effect. Once you use this trait, you are unable to use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and two languages of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: The Mithra tribe were birthed from the light of the Radiance. As such, as long as the Radiance continues to shine, so too will their lives, granting the race theoretical immortality. There are only a limited number of Mithra, however, and if the day that the Radiance's light dies ever comes to pass, the Mithra will be snuffed out for the rest of eternity.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: There exist two distinct ideologies within the Mithra tribe: those who sought true to their traditionalist beliefs and continued to worship the Radiance (lawful), and those who turned against the grain, pledging their allegiance to the Pale King and his army of a thousand strong (chaotic).

entries.name: Size
entries: While you are not human, your form has been designed after their own (give or take some mothlike appendages here-and-there). Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of yellow.

entries.name: Radiant Attuned Flight
entries: You have a flying speed equal to 10 + your walking speed. To use this speed, you must attune to the Way of Worlds by act of sacrificing an attunement slot. Attuning to flight takes the same amount of time and follows the same restrictions as attuning to a magic item.

entries.name: Designed for Flight
entries: Your base walking speed decreases to 20 feet, and creatures have advantage on checks made to knock you {@condition prone} while you are grounded.

entries.name: Gentle Descent
entries: As a reaction when you are knocked {@condition prone} mid-flight, or as a reaction when you would fall from an area of great height, you stretch out your mothlike wings and begin to glide.
Your rate of descent slows to 30 feet per round, and you can expend your walking speed to travel horizontally. If you land while gliding, you take no falling damage and land on your feet.

entries.name: Light of Radiance
entries: Your creature type is celestial, rather than humanoid. In addition, you gain access to the following benefits as per your mithran birthright:

items: The first time you would be subjected to radiant damage, you treat that attack as if you had immunity. Afterwards, your immunity transforms into resistance. This temporary immunity resets on a short or long rest.
You are immune to the {@condition blinded} condition (you're a moth).
You are immune to disease.
You cannot suffer from the effects of madness.

Magic cannot put you to sleep. In addition, instead of sleeping, you must engage in rest—a state that lasts for at least 4 hours a day. While resting, you are unmoving, semi-conscious of your form, and your vision is limited to a radius 30 feet. Finally, you cannot make Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks or perform any other tasks while resting.

entries.name: Wielder of Dreams
entries: As a bonus action, you tap into the power of the Essence, perceiving the world around you with the borrowed eyes of a god.

You gain {@sense truesight} out to a range of 30 feet, with the exception that you cannot see into the Ethereal Plane. This special sense lasts for 3 rounds (or eighteen seconds), and afterwards, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Celestial, and one language of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: An Imprisoned's existence is fueled by the element they embody. While they need not consume food or water, consuming their element increases their lifespans. As such, an Imprisoned is theoretically immortal, so long as it has access to its source: lightning, water, fire, and rock.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: To escape, one must defy tradition. Imprisoned are generally chaotic individuals who rebel against norms and practice forbidden arts. There are some that have come to terms with their bindings, and have sought enlightenment, but those individuals are few and far between.

entries.name: Size
entries: While you are not human, your form has been designed after their own, composed of the element you embody. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Bound By Magic
entries: Your creature type is elemental, rather than humanoid. In addition, each Imprisoned embodies an element. Choose an Embodied Element from the Embodied Element Table below. You gain resistance to damage and receive a feature determined by your element, as shown below.

entries.caption: Embodied Element
rows: {@bold Thundersoul}. You ignore non-magical difficult terrain.
{@bold Icesoul}. You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.
{@bold Flamesoul}. You exude bright light for 20 feet and dim light for an additional 20 feet.
{@bold Stonesoul}. You gain advantage on saving throws against the {@condition poisoned} condition.

entries.name: Unleash My Bindings!
entries: You break free from the chains which restrict your form, unleashing your internal energy in a boundless storm which annihilates those who dare to oppose you.
As an action, you become Unbound for one minute, after which your bindings reforge and reconstrict your astral form. While Unbound, you gain the following benefits:

items: Your creature size becomes Large.
Your attacks deal an additional {@dice 1d6} damage dependent on your Embodied Element: lightning for Air, cold for Water, fire for Fire, and magical bludgeoning for Earth.

Hostile creatures who start their turn within 5 feet of you take damage equal to your proficiency bonus dependent on your Embodied Element: lightning for Air, cold for Water, fire for Fire, and magical bludgeoning for Earth.

entries: Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Astral Rush
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you learn the signature ability of the Imprisoned. A special art which unleashes the power contained within in a short, terrifying electric burst. You resolve this feature differently depending on whether you are currently Bound or Unbound, as shown below.

{@b Bound.} As an action, you unleash a burst of your element. All hostile creatures within a 30-foot line must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to 12 + your proficiency bonus. On a failed save, those creatures take {@dice 3d6} damage, or half as much on a successful save.

This damage is dependent on your Embodied Element: lightning for Air, cold for Water, fire for Fire, and acid for Earth. The damage you deal increases from 3d6 to 4d6 at 5th level, 5d6 at 10th level, 6d6 at 15th level, and 7d6 at 20th level.

{@b Unbound.} As an action, you rush at at a creature with the blinding fury of an elemental. Choose one creature within 30 feet of you. That creature must make a Dexterity saving throw with a DC equal to 12 + your proficiency bonus as you rush at them, traveling until your form collides with their space. On a failed save, that creature is knocked back to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you and takes {@dice 4d6} damage. On a successful save, you are knocked back to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the creature, and that creature takes half damage.

This damage is dependent on your Embodied Element: lightning for Air, cold for Water, fire for Fire, and magical bludgeoning for Earth. The damage you deal increases from 4d6 to 5d6 at 5th level, 6d6 at 10th level, 7d6 at 15th level, and 8d6 at 20th level.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to half your proficiency bonus, rounded up, and regain all expended uses on a short or long rest.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Primordial.

entries.name: Age
entries: Kuo-toa reach maturity by age 10 and can live twice as long as humans, but the hatred they face and their own mounting insanity mean they rarely do so.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: The kuo-toas’ insanity often drives them towards evil, but not in any particularly chaotic or lawful way.

entries.name: Size
entries: Kuo-toa are only slightly smaller than humans on average, and weigh about the same. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Slippery Skin
entries: You have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Otherworldly Perception
entries: You can cast the {@spell see invisibility} spell once with this trait, requiring no material components, and you regain the ability to cast it this way when you finish a long rest. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (your choice) is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: God Making
entries: Due to the kuo-toas’ innate magical devotion, you can temporarily make an idol. As an action, you can choose a Tiny object that you can see within 30 feet of you. The object becomes a creature with the statistics of a kuo-toa idol for 1 hour or until it is reduced to 0 hit points, after which the object returns to normal. The idol is friendly to you and your companions, and obeys your verbal commands.
{@b Kuo-Toa Idol.} tiny construct, unaligned
{@b Armor Class —} 12
{@b Hit Points —} 10 (4d4)
{@b Speed —} 30 ft.
{@b Damage Immunities —} poison, psychic.
{@b Conditional Immunities —} charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned.
{@b Senses —} blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 10
{@b Languages —} understands Undercommon but can’t speak
{@b Illumination.} The kuo-toa idol sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.
{@b Slam.} Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 bludgeoning damage.
After you use this trait, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Undercommon.

entries.name: Age
entries: Karkinos are unique in that they are effectively immortal. So long as they continually shed their shells, which takes place annually, a karkinos can continue to live through the ages, though most eventually outpace their shedding capabilities and die at the age of 500 to 600.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: As peaceful pastoralists who drift through the domains of other underwater races, karkinos tend towards being lawful, obeying the rules of whatever race currently hosting them. They have little inclination towards either good or evil.

entries.name: Size
entries: Most karkinos stand between 5-6 feet tall, but are very bulky, weighing an average of 450 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Deep Sea Adaptation
entries: You are immune to the effects of being underwater at a depth greater than 100 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Pincers
entries: Your crustacean pincers are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. Immediately after hitting a target with an unarmed strike on your turn, you can use a bonus action to attempt to grapple the target.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: Your carapace is as hard as armor, and can turn aside lesser blows. When you aren’t wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield’s benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Pastoral Talents
entries: You are proficient in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill Nature}, or {@skill Perception}.

entries.name: Shepherd's Speech
entries: Tending to aquatic flocks for generations, your kind have a way with the creatures of the sea. You can communicate simple ideas with beasts that can breathe water. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special ability to understand them in return.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and two other languages of your choice. Karkinos are a wandering people, and often pick up languages from other oceanborne races, such as sea elves, triton, and locathah.

entries.name: Age
entries: Forged eons ago in the fusion furnaces of a now-dead star, a novakid lives for as long as their core burns—and their core burns with the ferocity of a large star. It is estimated that the lifespan of a novakid is somewhere in the ballpark of 10 million years. To date, most novakids alive are well past the 10,000 mark, a result of having been forged so long ago.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Freedom lovers who strive to exemplify simplicity and self-expression, a novakid's free-spirited nature, matched with their short memories and equally short attention spans, tend to result in a more chaotic loving individual that leans toward the aspects of good.

entries.name: Size
entries: The size and form of a novakid resembles that of human, yet their bodies weigh almost nothing. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Shooting Star
entries: Compounding the oddity of the novakid's existence is their culture, which greatly resembles that of the "Wild West" era of Kagrea's history. Because of their strange culture, the art of gunplay has been instilled into their teachings, and most novakids know a thing or two about akimbo. Select two firearms to gain proficiency in.

entries.name: Brand & Shell
entries: The  force that drives a novakid is contained within the brand on their faces. Charged with huge amounts of energy, these pieces of metal generate the hard plasma “shells” which stop their constituent gases from leaking.

If a novakid is depleted of his or her vital gases, the energy contained within their brand is instantly vented into the very fabric of spacetime, leaving only a twisted metal symbol and a nearly undetectable warping of light around the area of death.
Choose a brand from the table below to assume as your own. Each metal brand instills a different force within its wielder, and generally represents the novakid's personality.

entries.caption: Select a Brand
rows: In conditions of clear visibility, you can make out details of even extremely distant creatures and objects as small as 2 feet across.
You gain advantage on {@skill Perception} and {@skill Investigation} checks made to search for treasure.
You exude bright light for 20 feet and dim light for an additional 20 feet.
You have advantage on checks made to discern the value or worth gems, art pieces, and magical items.
You gain proficiency in the operation and use of land vehicles, including horses.
Whenever you make a check pertaining to the stars or other cosmic bodies, you can add twice your proficiency bonus, instead of any proficiency bonus you normally apply.
You gain a +2 bonus on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks made to determine if a creature is lying to you.
You gain proficiency in one artisan tool of your choice.
You gain proficiency in one musical instrument of your choice.

entries.name: Starfall
entries: As an action, you begin to shed your gasous form, exuding stardust as the weight of your body becomes less dense than air. For the next minute minute, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed. Once this effect wears off, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: We Must Ruin the West
entries: Novakid are a perfect example of nature’s emergent beauty, an existence forged in the stars for no real purpose other than to become rootin' tootin' cowboys. As a member of the novakid species, you gain the following benefits:

items: Your creature type is construct, rather than humanoid.
You have resistance to radiant damage.
You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}, and you have resistance to poison damage.
You are immune to disease.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe, and can survive in a vacuum.
When you regain hit points from a source that specifies it does not function on constructs, you instead receive half as many hit points as the source would provide, rounded down, instead of none.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Celestial, and one additional language of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: Zombies, sustained by the necromantic magic that created them, do not age. However, over time, their bodies will begin to rot. Whether or not a zombie's body is maintained is generally up to the zombie in question—some prefer the beauty of living life, whereas others prefer flesh hanging from bone.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Whether or not a zombie sees their death and subsequent revival as unjust has much to do with their outlook upon resurrection. As a free zombie, your alignment is not forced into one particular methodology of thinking—you are an agent of your own desire.

entries.name: Size
entries: Zombies can be made from any humanoid creature, ranging from the shortest human to the tallest goliath. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Your sight has been restored by necromancy, giving you unnaturally sharp vision. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Unnatural Creation
entries: Who resurrected me? What is my purpose? These are the thoughts a free zombie may spend their entire life pondering. While a special few free zombies know and may even interact with their masters, the act of creating a free zombie is generally one done through accident or mishap.
Yet still, this method of existence isn't all bad! As a free zombie, you gain the following benefits:

items: Your creature type is undead, rather than humanoid.
You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}, and you have resistance to poison damage.
You are immune to disease.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.

Instead of sleeping, you enter an inactive state for 4 hours each day. You do not dream in this state, but resting in this way is otherwise identical to sleeping. Magically induced sleep can cause you to enter this inactive state.

entries.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage would leave you with 0 hit points, you can make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or a critical hit. On a successful save, you are reduced to 1 hit point instead. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: The Limbs Have Left the Station
entries: Your body parts are malleable, designed to easily be detached and reattached as a nature of the necromantic energies which sustain your existence. You can detatch or reattach any of your severed body parts at will, so long as:

items: Those body parts were not vital to the continued existence of the race you were before your resurrection.
Those body parts were originally connected via a joint or central muscle.

entries: {@bold Note:} An example of a body parts that can be reattached are arms and legs. Organs, meanwhile, are not considered limbs for the purposes of this feature, and must be reattached through surgical means if severed (not that you need most of them, anyway).

Limbs you detach with this feature or are severed lose their ability to function, with the exception of limbs that remain attached to your hands. Your hands have the ability to crawl across the ground with a base movement speed of 10, but can only move towards you and cannot interact with objects, weapons, or the environment in a direct way.

You can also detatch and reattach your head, despite it being considered a vital organ. While detached or severed, you are considered {@condition blinded}, but not {@condition deafened}. You also retain the ability to speak, but your voice eminates from your body, rather than your mouth.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one additional language of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: Kitsune mature slowly, achieving adulthood at 20 and living up to 300 with only one tail.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Born in the epicenter of Yonia between the mortal plane and the spiritual plane, Kitsune adhere mostly to a neutral alignment. Some will align with humanity, and awaken a spark of good, while others align with the darkness and become Nogitsune.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is Medium when in human form. In fox form, your size is Small.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have advantage on {@skill Perception} checks pertaining to scent or hearing.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Fey in origin, Kitsune can see in dim light within 60 feet as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim. You cannot discern color in darkness, only in shades of gray.

entries.name: The Nine Tailed Path
entries: Kitsune begin with a single fox tail generally 3 feet long. At 4th level and every 2 levels afterwards, you grow an additional tail as you grow in worldly experience. Each tail you possess increases your lifespan by 100 years. Tails which are cut off or otherwise removed do not grow back naturally, but may be restored by use of the {@spell regenerate} spell. Losing a tail or tails does not affect the years you gain of extended life.

entries.name: Shapeshift
entries: Your connection to the Feywild and bonds with the Spirit Realm allow you to transform into your ancestral half—a being who represents your clan and their ancestors, also known as a Spirit Fox.

You can transform between your fox and human forms as an action. Alternatively, you can choose to transform from a fox back into a human as a bonus action. While in your Spirit Fox form, you maintain the ability to read, write, and speak any languages you already know, but lose the ability to cast spells other than cantrips.
Your weapons and clothes transform with you when you use this ability. While your paws are dexterous enough to handle small complex tasks, you cannot use weapons in combat.

While you are in your Spirit Fox form, your base movement speed becomes 40. If your base movement speed was equal to 40 or higher before your transformation, it instead increases by an additional 5 feet. In addition, you gain access to your Bite and Claw attacks (mentioned under the Slash & Maul racial feature) while in your Spirit Fox form.
Instead to changing shape, you can choose to instead hide your ears and tail(s) to appear human completely. This transformation acts like a limited version of the {@spell alter self} spell.

entries.name: Slash and Maul
entries: You are proficient with your unarmed strikes. When you make an unarmed attack, decide whether you're attacking with your claws or your bite. Your claws deal {@dice 1d4} slashing damage on a hit, whereas your bite deals {@dice 1d6} piercing damage.

entries.name: First Clan of Flame
entries: Your unarmed claw attacks now deal {@dice 1d4} fire damage.

entries.name: Sticky Fingers
entries: You have advantage on {@skill Sleight of Hand} checks made to pick pockets without being noticed.

entries.name: Trickster
entries: When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and take the higher amount. You can use this feature once per tail you possess, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Sylvan, and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Second Clan of Ice
entries: Your unarmed claw attacks now deal {@dice 1d4} cold damage.

entries.name: Detective
entries: You gain advantage on Intelligence checks made to discover clues and piece together evidence.

entries.name: Logical Mind
entries: Your mind is inherently logical, and is not easily swayed. As a bonus action, you can end one effect causing you to be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}. You can use this feature once per tail you possess, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Sylvan, and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Third Clan of the Moon
entries: Your unarmed claw attacks now deal {@dice 1d4} radiant damage.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: Blessed by the moon, the Tsuki can call upon its illumination to enhance their eyes as naturally as they breathe. Your darkvision improves to 120 feet, represented by your internal connection to your clan's symbol.

entries.name: Lunar Charm
entries: As an action you can target a creature within 30 feet of you and force them to behold the beauty of the moon. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier. On a failed save, that creature becomes charmed to you until the end of your next turn.

A creature who is charmed by you this way must move away from you on their turn—the moon must be marveled from a distance, after all. The creature moves a number of feet away from you equal to 2.5 × the number of tails you possess (rounded down to the nearest 5-foot increment), and must keep that distance from you until the charm wears off. If the result of this equation would be 0, the creature is not required to move away from you.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Sylvan, and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Fourth Clan of the Mist
entries: Your unarmed claw attacks now deal {@dice 1d4} thunder damage.

entries.name: Born From Mist
entries: As a bonus action, you can gain advantage on any {@skill Perception} or {@skill Stealth} check you make. You can use this feature once per tail you possess, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Misty Escape
entries: As a reaction to taking damage, you can create a 20-foot-radius sphere of mist centered on you. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for one minute or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Sylvan, and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Fifth Clan of Shadow
entries: Your unarmed claw attacks now deal {@dice 1d8} necrotic damage.

entries.name: Born From Beast
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Intimidation} skill.

entries.name: Frightening Presence
entries: While in your natural fox form, your size is Medium instead of Small. Your eyes turn red and your fur turns a charred ashen black. As a bonus action, you can emit an aura of fear with a raidus equal to 2.5 × the number of tails you possess. Hostile creatures who enter the aura must make a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you. The DC for this ability is 8 + your Charisma modifier + your proficiency bonus.

Your opponent may make another saving throw at the end of their next turn. On a success, they are no longer frightened, and are immune to your aura for 24 hours. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Sylvan, and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: Revenant do not age. Given time, the necromantic energies that sustain you will heal most wounds you take at approximately the same rate as a mortal, and your hit die function as normal. A Revenant escapes the Rift due to one emotion they hold dear to their hearts. Emotions such as "Hope", "Anger", and "Desire" are common emotions among Revenants. Once the emotion that ties their existence dissipates (like the desire to see one's family, or the anger to see an enemy dead), the necromantic energies evaporate, and the Revenant dies.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Many Revenants cling to the alignment they held in their life, even if that life is but a distant memory in their minds. For others, the act of being swallowed by the Rift changes them drastically, and they adopt a new world view in light of what Shao has taught them.

entries.name: Past Life
entries: Choose another race besides this one; the race you select must be humanoid and lack the Living Construct trait (or similar). Even after being swallowed by the Rift, you maintain vague memories of this past life as this race. Your size, height, and movement speed are the same as this race. You do not retain special movement speeds from this race (such as flying, climbing, or swimming), and you do not carry over any racial features. If your past race had subraces, select one, but you do not carry over any racial features from that either.

entries.name: Living Dead
entries: You have been brought back from the Rift, but your form has changed drastically. You are immune to disease. You do not need to eat or breathe, but you can ingest food and drink if you wish. Additionally, you have two creature types: humanoid and undead. You can be affected by a spell or ability that works on either of your creature types.

entries.name: Onward to Salvation
entries: Escaping the Rift was no easy feat, and your new undead body assisted you in this endeavor. As an undead, you rarely tire. You treat exhaustion as if it was one level less. In addition, instead of sleeping, you enter an inactive state for 4 hours each day. You do not dream in this state; you are fully aware of your surroundings and notice approaching enemies and other events as normal.

entries.name: Unholy Gospel
entries: After breaking out of the Rift, you received a blessing known colloquially as a gospel. Unlike other undead, you can be restored through healing magic, but it has a significantly dampened effect on you. When you regain hit points from a source that specifies it does not function on undead, you instead receive half as many hit points as the source would provide, rounded down, instead of none.

entries.name: Eternal Vengeance
entries: The presence of those who reside in the Rift registers on the senses like a noxious odor. As an action, you can open your awareness to detect such creatures. Until the end of your next turn, you know the location of any beings who originated from the Rift Plane within 60 feet of you that is not behind total cover. You can use this feature a number of times equal to 1 + your Constitution modifier. When you finish a long rest, you regain all expended uses.

entries.name: Driven
entries: You have advantage on saving throws that would turn undead or would cause you to be {@condition Frightened}.

entries.name: Resurrection Beyond Death
entries: When you drop to 0 hit points, you can choose to stay conscious instead of falling unconscious. If you do, gain temporary hit points equal to your total character level + your Constitution modifier (minimum 1), which lasts for up to 1 minute.

In this state, you can take an action or a bonus action on your turn, but not both, and can move up to only half your movement speed. You remain in this state until you regain hit points, or until you no longer have temporary hit points. If you lose all temporary hit points in this state while you are at 0 hit points, you fall unconscious and begin making death saving throws as normal. Once you use this trait, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and two other languages of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: Skeletons do not age in the traditional sense, but they do decay over time. The necromantic energies that sustain you will heal most wounds you take at approximately the same rate as a mortal, and your hit die function as normal. A skeleton will generally live up to a maximum of two hundred years, at which their soul will be absorbed back into the Rift Plane to be reincarnated once more.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: An outcast in even minority socieites, the Skeleton is not without its fair share of natural enemies. In order to survive, they inclined to start a nation all of their own. Because to this, they tend to share a lawful bent. Apart from that, their inclination towards good or evil is not stagnant. The best and worst live among their numbers.

entries.name: Past Life
entries: Choose another race besides this one; the race you select must be humanoid and lack the Living Construct trait (or similar). Even after becoming a Wraith (and later a Skeleton), you maintain vague memories of this past life as this race. Your size, height, and movement speed are the same as this race. You do not retain special movement speeds from this race (such as flying, climbing, or swimming), and you do not carry over any racial features. If your past race had subraces, select one, but you do not carry over any racial features from that either.

entries.name: Living Dead
entries: You are immune to disease. You do not need to eat or breathe, but you can ingest food and drink if you wish. Additionally, your creature type is undead, rather than humanoid.

entries.name: Onward to Salvation
entries: With no pulse to drive you and no veins to pump blood, your body must be designed to operate at its maximum capacity almost always. As an undead, you rarely tire. You treat exhaustion as if it was one level less. In addition, instead of sleeping, you enter an inactive state for 4 hours each day. You do not dream in this state; you are fully aware of your surroundings and notice approaching enemies and other events as normal.

entries.name: Curse of the Undead
entries: A tragic fate lies the souls of the damned. With no life force contained within their souls, an unfortunate majority of skeletons meet a tragic fate while on the battlefield. Like most undead, healing effects that state they do not work on undead have no effect on you.

entries.name: Collapse
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. If you do, reduce yourself to a pile of bones and render yourself {@condition prone}. You are considered to be under similar effects to the {@spell feign death} spell. While subject to this condition, you are unable to move or take actions other than using an action to end this effect. Once you use this trait, you are unable to use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Bloodless
entries: You are immune to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition.

entries.name: Them Bones
entries: If both your hands are unoccupied, you can use a bonus action to rearrange your skeletal structure, or return your body to its original configuration. When you rearrange your bones, choose one of the following options, any of which are considered to occupy both of your hands:

• You remove an arm and use it as a bone club. While used as a weapon, you have proficiency with your removed arm, which is a melee weapon with the finesse property that deals 1d6 bludgeoning damage on it. This weapon also has the light property, but for all intents and purposes, that fact is of little use.

• You remove a hand and hold it in your other as if it were a set of thieves' tools. This hand is capable of manipulating locks through picking, cutting glass, and any other function a normal set of thieves' tools could achieve.

• You remove two of your ribs and use the rest of them as a musical instrument. This instrument is referred to as the Bone Xylophone, and while playing you gain advantage on Performance checks meant to entertain children.
• You gain pull out several of your bones in an attempt to juggle them.
• You can remove your skull from its socket and use your arm to look around walls.
Your bones lose their animation if they are further than 5-feet away from your main body. If your skull loses animation, you are blinded and deafened until a skull is reaffixed to your body.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and two other languages of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: Scarecrows do not age in the traditional sense, but they do decay over time. The necromantic energies that sustain you will heal most wounds you take at approximately the same rate as a mortal, and your hit die function as normal. A scarecrow will generally live up to a maximum of five hundred years, at which their soul will be absorbed back into the Void to be reincarnated once more.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Scarecrow hold on to the alignments of their previous incarnations. Most are created by witches and hags and as such tend to be evil, as it better suits the purposes of their creators. An especially malicious hag could take delight into binding a traditionally good human soul into the body of a scarecrow and revel over corrupting their soul over the course of centuries.

entries.name: Living Construct
entries: Scarecrow are gifted with supernatural properties. You are immune to disease. You do not need to eat or breathe, but you can ingest food and drink if you wish. Additionally, you have two creature types: humanoid and construct. You can be affected by a spell or ability that works on either of your creature types.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: The forces behind your animation imbue you with the power to watch over the holdings of your masters, by day or night. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Silent Night
entries: After standing completely still for at least one minute, you appear to be a scarecrow that is indistinguishable from an inanimate construct. In addition, you make no sound, and only magic can be used to detect whether you are alive or not. If you take damage in this state, you also show no outward signs of pain, and spells that would cause you to speak or make sound like {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter} have no effect.

entries.name: Body of Straw
entries: You are immune to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition. As a result of your bodily structure, whenever you take fire damage, you take additional damage equal to 5 - your Constitution modifier. This damage cannot be reduced or ignored by resistance or immunity.

entries.name: Claws of the Damned
entries: You possess clawed fingers on each of your hands, giving you a natural claw attack, which you may use as an unarmed strike. This claw attack deals slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + either your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice). In addition, you can use Dexterity in place of Strength for attack rolls with your claws, and your claws are considered to be a melee weapon with the finesse property for any ability or feature that requires it.

entries.name: Frighten Crows
entries: Any crows or ravens of CR 1 or less within 60 feet of you are automatically frightened of you until they are no longer within this range. This ability has no effect on familiars conjured by the {@spell find familiar} spell or similar sources.

entries.name: Scarecrow's Vigil
entries: Instead of sleeping, you enter an inactive state for 4 hours each day, standing completely motionless and sometimes (for a better vantage, or because old habits are hard to break) affixed to a tree or post. You do not dream in this state; you are fully aware of your surroundings and notice approaching enemies and other events as normal. While you remain motionless, whether or not you are in this inactive state, you are indistinguishable from a normal scarecrow.

entries.name: Glare of the Void
entries: As a bonus action, target one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw against a DC of 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier. If the creature fails this saving throw, it is frightened of you until the end of your next turn. Once you use this ability successfully, you require a short or long rest before you can use it again.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: Young demibeasts grow quickly, reaching maturity by 10 years of age, but only live for up to 80 years. Many demibeasts see dying as a result of old age as a sign of weakness, and as such, most demibeast die in battle or during their hunts. There are a few, though, such as those who take on the appearance of sheep, as multiple years of sedimentary living have left them more passive then their brethren.

entries.name: Size
entries: Demibeasts of the wolf blood are taller and heavier than humans, standing well over 6 feet tall and averaging almost 250 pounds. Sheep blood, however, tend to be equivalent in size to the average human. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Demibeasts tend toward no particular alignment. The best and the worst are found among them.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to roaming under the night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Man & the Beast
entries: You have two creature types: humanoid and beast. You can be affected by a spell or ability that works on either of your creature types.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Choose one of the abilities you did not increase between Strength, Constitution, or Wisdom. That ability score increases by 1.

entries.name: Gait of the Wolf
entries: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

entries.name: Howl of the Beast
entries: When you roll initiative and aren't surprised, you can use your reaction to unleash a howl to rally your allies for battle. You can choose a number of friendly creatures that can hear you equal to your Consitution or Wisdom modifier (your choice). If any of those creatures are surprised, they're no longer surprised, and they can move up to half their speed as a reaction. After you use your battle howl, you can't use it again until you complete a long rest.

entries.name: Carnivorous Bite
entries: Your fanged maw is a natural weapon, which you are proficient with. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d8} + your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Birthright
entries: You grew up in a territory that grants you benefits. Choose one of the types of territories from the Demibeast Territory table. You only need to sleep for 4 hours while performing a long rest in your territory, as you've adapted to survival there. Additionally, you're naturally adapted to the climate associated with your territory, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.
If no climate is specialized under the climate benefit column, you instead gain advantage on saving throws against any conditions mentioned.

entries.name: Unrivaled Hunter
entries: Whenever you make a Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) check related to smelling out a trail or following a creature's scent, you are considered proficient in the Survival skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Language
entries: You begin with Common and Beastspeech. Beastspeech can only be learned by Demis and, when speaking it, they can communicate with the animal they resemble as if under the effect of the spell, {@spell speak with animals}. For example, a sheep demibeast could speak with sheep.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Choose one of the abilities you did not increase between Dexterity, Intelligence, or Charisma. That ability score increases by 1.

entries.name: Sure-Footed
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being knocked {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Ram
entries: You can use your head and horns to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Herd Mentality
entries: So long as there is an ally within 15 feet of you, you have advantage on saving throws that would cause you to be {@condition frightened}.

entries.name: Peak Dwellers
entries: You're acclimated to high altitude, including elevations above 20,000 feet. You're also naturally adapted to strong wind and cold environments, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

entries.name: Counting Sheep
entries: At 1st level, you can cast the {@spell sleep} spell once per long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast {@spell sleep} at 3rd level once per short or long rest. Intelligence or Charisma (your choice) is your spellcasting modifier for this spell.

entries.name: Language
entries: You begin with Common and Beastspeech. Beastspeech can only be learned by Demis and, when speaking it, they can communicate with the animal they resemble as if under the effect of the spell, {@spell speak with animals}. For example, a sheep demibeast could speak with sheep.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Choose one of the abilities you did not increase between Constitution or Wisdom. That ability score increases by 1.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Mountain Born
entries: You're acclimated to high altitude, including elevations above 20,000 feet. You're also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

entries.name: Rugged Hide
entries: The body of the Ursus has calloused over the years, becoming as tough as hardened leather. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 12 + your Constitution modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Stench of War
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks related to determining a creature's location using the smell of blood, or deciphering the species of a creature using their blood.

entries.name: Protector of the Ursa
entries: When an ally within 10-feet of you is subject to a Dexterity saving throw, you may choose to intercept the effect and have it target you instead. When you use this feature, the Dexterity saving throw instead becomes a Strength saving throw for you. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Language
entries: You begin with Common and Beastspeech. Beastspeech can only be learned by Demis and, when speaking it, they can communicate with the animal they resemble as if under the effect of the spell, {@spell speak with animals}. For example, a sheep demibeast could speak with sheep.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Choose one of the abilities you did not increase between Strength or Constitution. That ability score increases by 1.

entries.name: Gait of the Lion
entries: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

entries.name: Claws
entries: Your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you can deal slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Rout the Enemy!
entries: As a bonus action, you can let out an especially menacing roar. Creatures of your choice within 30 feet of you that can hear you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of you until the end of your next turn. The DC of the save equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Clamber
entries: Your build and lion-like physique allow you to tread across dangerous terrain with added stability. When you move on your turn in combat, you can take to all fours, ignoring difficult terrain until the end of the turn. Once you use this trait, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Heightened Resolve
entries: You have advantage on saving throws made to resist the {@condition poisoned} condition, and your hit points are doubled for the purposes of resolving the negative effects of the {@spell sleep} spell.

entries.name: Language
entries: You begin with Common and Beastspeech. Beastspeech can only be learned by Demis and, when speaking it, they can communicate with the animal they resemble as if under the effect of the spell, {@spell speak with animals}. For example, a sheep demibeast could speak with sheep.

entries.name: Age
entries: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: After receiving a Mark from Arka, the Passionate Reveler, Humans tend to manifest a lawful nature, even under less than ideal nuturing conditions.

entries.name: Artisan's Intuition
entries: When you make an {@skill Arcana} check or an ability check involving artisan's tools, you can roll a {@dice 1d4} and add the number rolled to the ability check.

entries.name: Arka's Gift
entries: You gain proficiency with one type of artisan's tools of your choice.

entries.name: Spellsmith
entries: You know the {@spell mending} cantrip. You can also cast the magic weapon spell with this trait. When you do so, the spell lasts for 1 hour and doesn't require concentration. Once you cast the spell with this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice. Humans typically learn the languages of other peoples they deal with, including obscure dialects. They are fond of sprinkling their speech with words borrowed from other tongues: Orc curses, Elvish musical expressions, Dwarvish military phrases, and so on.

entries.name: Age
entries: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: After receiving a Mark from Kurmok, the Perservering Entity, Humans tend to manifest a good nature, even under less than ideal nuturing conditions.

entries.name: Sentinel's Intuition
entries: When you make an {@skill Insight} or {@skill Perception} check, you can roll a {@dice 1d4} and add the number rolled to the ability check.

entries.name: Guardian's Shield
entries: You can cast the {@spell shield} spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to cast it after you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: Vigilant
entries: When a creature you can see within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can use your reaction to swap places with that creature, and you are hit by the attack instead. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Bound by the Duel
entries: You can cast the {@spell compelled duel} spell with this trait. Once you cast the spell with this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice. Humans typically learn the languages of other peoples they deal with, including obscure dialects. They are fond of sprinkling their speech with words borrowed from other tongues: Orc curses, Elvish musical expressions, Dwarvish military phrases, and so on.

entries.name: Age
entries: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: After receiving a Mark from Obstract, the Disparity Daemon, Humans tend bend towards being chaotic. They also tend to manifest a good nature, even under less than ideal nuturing conditions.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Hunter's Intuition
entries: When you make a {@skill Perception} or {@skill Survival} check, you can roll a {@dice 1d4} and add the number rolled to the ability check.

entries.name: Finder's Magic
entries: You can cast the {@spell hunter's mark} spell with this trait. Starting at 3rd level, you can also cast the {@spell locate object} spell with it. Once you cast either spell with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice. Humans typically learn the languages of other peoples they deal with, including obscure dialects. They are fond of sprinkling their speech with words borrowed from other tongues: Orc curses, Elvish musical expressions, Dwarvish military phrases, and so on.

entries.name: Age
entries: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: After receiving a Mark from Gaia, the Mother of All Life, Humans tend bend towards a feeling of neutrality. They also tend to have a greater respect for wildlife.

entries.name: Wild Intuition
entries: When you make a {@skill Animal Handling} or {@skill Nature} check, you can roll a {@dice 1d4} and add the number rolled to the ability check.

entries.name: Primal Connection
entries: You can cast the {@spell animal friendship} and {@spell speak with animals} spells with this trait, requiring no material component. Once you cast either spell with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a short or long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: The Bigger They Are
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can target a beast or monstrosity when you cast {@spell animal friendship} or {@spell speak with animals}, provided the creature's Intelligence score is 3 or lower.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice. Humans typically learn the languages of other peoples they deal with, including obscure dialects. They are fond of sprinkling their speech with words borrowed from other tongues: Orc curses, Elvish musical expressions, Dwarvish military phrases, and so on.

entries.name: Age
entries: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: After receiving a Mark from Amaathu, the Great Overseer, Humans tend bend towards a feeling of neutrality. They also tend to be more punctual and pertinent when receiving orders.

entries.name: Gait of Time
entries: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

entries.name: Intuitive Motion
entries: When you make an {@skill Acrobatics} check or any ability check to operate or maintain a land vehicle, you can roll a {@dice 1d4} and add the number rolled to the ability check.

entries.name: Magical Passage
entries: You can cast the {@spell misty step} spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest. Dexterity is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice. Humans typically learn the languages of other peoples they deal with, including obscure dialects. They are fond of sprinkling their speech with words borrowed from other tongues: Orc curses, Elvish musical expressions, Dwarvish military phrases, and so on.

entries.name: Age
entries: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Humans tend toward no particular alignment. The best and the worst are found among them.

entries.name: Size
entries: Humans vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed Step
entries: In combat, you can use a bonus action to immediately gain the benefits of the Dash action. You can only use this trait once per long rest.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice. Humans typically learn the languages of other peoples they deal with, including obscure dialects. They are fond of sprinkling their speech with words borrowed from other tongues: Orc curses, Elvish musical expressions, Dwarvish military phrases, and so on.

entries.name: Age
entries: Orcs reach adulthood at age 12 and live up to 50 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: The orcs of Kagreth are a passionate people, given to powerful emotion and deep faith. They are generally chaotic, but can be any alignment.

entries.name: Size
entries: Orcs are usually over 6 feet tall and weigh between 230 and 280 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, you can move up to your movement speed toward a hostile creature you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.

entries.name: Menacing
entries: You are trained in the {@skill Intimidation} skill.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Savage Dissonance
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points, before you fall unconscious, you can use your reaction to make one melee attack against a creature within melee range. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Orc.

entries.name: Age
entries: Dhampirs mature at the same rate as humans, but can live for centuries.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Dhampirs might not have an innate tendency toward evil, but many end up there. They are typically neutral.

entries.name: Size
entries: Dhampirs are the same size and build as humans. Your size is medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Thanks to your heritage, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Vampiric Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against diseases and being {@condition Charmed}.

entries.name: Undead Resistance
entries: You have resistance to necrotic damage.

entries.name: Vampiric Drip
entries: Your fanged bite is a natural weapon, which counts as a simple melee weapon with which you are proficient. You add your Constitution modifier to the attack and damage rolls with your bite. Your bite deals {@dice 1d4} piercing damage on a hit, and you have advantage on bite attacks while you are missing half or more of your hit points.
When you use your bite and hit a creature that isn’t a Construct or an Undead, you can empower yourself in one of the following ways of your choice:

items: You regain hit points equal to the damage dealt by the bite. This healing does not account for damage from outside sources, such as class abilities or magic items.

You gain a bonus to the next ability check or attack roll you make; this bonus is equal to the damage dealt by the bite. This bonus does not account for damage from outside sources, such as class abilities or magic items.

entries: You can empower yourself with your bite a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and another language of your choice.

entries.name: Kin of Mine
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} and {@skill Stealth} skills.

entries.name: Misty Escape
entries: As a reaction to taking damage, you can create a 20-foot-radius sphere of fog centered on you. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for one minute or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: Thanks to your heritage, you have first-rate vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on {@skill Perception} checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Uncanny Climber
entries: You have advantage on any {@skill Athletics} check made to climb difficult surfaces.

entries.name: Dark Hopsitality
entries: You have proficiency in one of the following skills: {@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Persuasion}.

entries.name: Vampiric Charm
entries: You can cast {@spell charm person} with this trait, using Charisma as your spellcasting ability for it. Once you cast it, you can’t cast it again with this trait until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: Thanks to your heritage, you have first-rate vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on {@skill Perception} checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Vermin Speech
entries: You can cast {@spell animal friendship} an unlimited number of times with this trait, but you can target only bats, rats, and wolves with it. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries: If you aren't in sunlight, you can use your action to cast polymorph on yourself to transform into a bat, rat, or wolf. When cast in this way, polymorph requires no components and cannot be dispelled. It has the following changes:

• Your game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the beast, but you retain your alignment, personality, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. You also retain all of your skill and saving throw proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of the creature. If the creature has the same proficiency as you and the bonus in its stat block is higher than yours, use the creature’s bonus instead of yours.

• You retain the benefit of any features from your class, race, or other source and can use them if the new form is physically capable of doing so. However, you can’t use any of your special senses, such as darkvision, unless your new form also has that sense.
Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Age
entries: All Vespids reach maturity at 12, beyond this workers live about as long as 75 years, drones as long as 350 years, and workers that become queens can live as long as 750 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Vespidan societies are invariably highly structured and caste-based. They are almost always strongly lawful and usually lawful neutral as the good of the hive supersedes all other concerns. The exception are the hive- broken who are still often lawful by upbringing, but can easily stray into any form of thinking from there.

entries.name: Size
entries: Workers and Drones are small sized, while Queens are medium sized.

entries.name: Multiarmed
entries: All Vespids are born with 4 arms. Your two additional arms allow you to interact with an additional object or feature of the environment for free on your turn. You may not carry and use shields for defense with these additional arms. Nor do they grant you additional attacks, or allow you to wield weapons with them for combat.

entries.name: Flight
entries: As part of a move action, a Vespidan can instead fly 30 feet, but must end their movement on the ground or a solid surface. A Vespidan who ends its turn in the air immediately plummets to the ground. To use this speed you can't be wearing heavy armor or be encumbered.

entries.name: Carapace
entries: Your Carapace provides limited protection, and makes you accustomed to wearing armor. You can calculate your base AC as 11 + your Dexterity modifier while not wearing armor, and a shield’s benefits apply as normal while you use this AC. While wearing medium armor, your maximum Dexterity modifier bonus is increased by 1.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Elvish.

entries.name: Inspiring Queen
entries: You may use the Help action as a bonus action, for a number of times equal to your Proficiency bonus. You regain the ability to use the Help action this way after finishing a short or long rest. At level 3, when you use the Help action to aid an ally in attacking a creature, the target of that attack can be within 30 feet of you, rather than within 5 feet of you. Should the ally already have advantage, then it may add half your proficiency bonus (rounded up) to the attack's hit and damage roll instead.

entries.name: Sting
entries: Your sting is a natural weapon, which you can use to 4 make a unarmed strike with. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. On a hit, you may choose to inject the target with your venom, after which you must spend a long rest before you can use your venom again.

This venom causes the target to take {@dice 2d6} poison damage, and it must make a Constitution saving throw (DC: 10 + your Proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier). On a failed save, it is also {@condition Poisoned} until the start of your next turn. The poison damage increases to 3d6 at 5th level. 4d6 at 10th level, 5d6 at 15th level, and 6d6 at 20th level.

entries.name: Insightful Monarch
