entries: You have proficiency in the Insight skill, and advantage on saving throws to avoid being charmed.

entries.name: Swarm Tactics
entries: You have advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated. You may only benefit from this trait once per turn.

entries.name: Sting
entries: Your sting is a natural weapon, which you can use to 4 make a unarmed strike with. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. On a hit, you may choose to inject the target with your venom, after which you must spend a long rest before you can use your venom again.

This venom causes the target to take {@dice 2d6} poison damage, and it must make a Constitution saving throw (DC: 10 + your Proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier). On a failed save, it is also {@condition Poisoned} until the start of your next turn. The poison damage increases to 3d6 at 5th level. 4d6 at 10th level, 5d6 at 15th level, and 6d6 at 20th level.

entries.name: Talented Builder
entries: You have proficiency in one Tool of your choice. In addition, you learn new Tool proficiencies in half the normal amount of downtime weeks, rounded down. This reduction is applied last, after any reduction you may receive from your Intelligence modifier.

entries.name: Magic Savant
entries: After finishing a short or long rest you may choose one of the following spells: {@spell animal friendship}, {@spell misty step}, or {@spell shield}. You may cast this chosen spell once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to choose and cast a spell in this manner after finishing a short or long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Harmonic Casting
entries: When you cast a non-cantrip spell you may channel some of the magic into yourself or a creature you can see within 60 feet. The chosen creature gains temporary hit points equal to the spell's level plus your proficiency bonus. Creatures may only be affected by this trait once, after which they may be affected again after they finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Gregarious
entries: You have proficiency in the Persuasion skill. Giant Wasps that are {@condition Charmed} by you will actively protect and fight for you.

entries.name: Age
entries: A typical warforged is between two and thirty years old. The maximum warforged lifespan remains a mystery; so far, warforged have shown no signs of deterioration due to age. You are immune to magical aging effects.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most warforged take comfort in order and discipline, tending toward law and neutrality. But some have absorbed the morality, or lack thereof, of the beings with which they served.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Constructed Resilience
entries: You were created to have remarkable fortitude, represented by the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition Poisoned}, and you have resistance to poison damage.
You are immune to disease.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe, and can survive in a vacuum.
You don't need to sleep and don't suffer the effects of {@condition Exhaustion} due to lack of rest, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Sentry's Rest
entries: When you take a long rest, you must spend at least six hours of it in an inactive, motionless state, rather than sleeping. In this state, you appear inert, but it doesn't render you {@condition unconscious}, and you can see and hear as normal.

entries.name: Integrated Protection
entries: Your body has built-in defensive layers, which can be enhanced with armor:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to Armor Class.

You can don only armor with which you have proficiency. To don armor, you must incorporate it into your body over the course of 1 hour, during which you remain in contact with the armor. To doff armor, you must spend 1 hour removing it. You can rest while donning or doffing armor in this way.
While you live, your armor can't be removed from your body against your will.

entries.name: Specialized Design
entries: You gain one skill proficiency of your choice, one {@book tool|phb|5|tools} proficiency of your choice, and fluency in one language of your choice.
In addition, if you do not already know it, you learn to speak Neural.

entries.name: Integrated Tool
entries: Choose one tool you're proficient with. This tool is integrated into your body, and you double your proficiency bonus for any ability checks you make with it. You must have your hands free to use this integrated tool.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Neural.

entries.name: Iron Fists
entries: When you hit with an unarmed strike, you can deal {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier bludgeoning damage, instead of the normal damage for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Neural.

entries.name: Swift
entries: Your walking speed increases by 5 feet.

entries.name: Light Step
entries: When you are traveling alone for an extended period of time (one hour or more), you can move stealthily at a normal pace. (See chapter 8 of the Player's Handbook for information about travel pace.)

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Neural.

entries.name: Age
entries: Toran grow up very fast, and live very long lives. Torans reach adulthood at age 13. On average, they live about 300 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: Toran are between 2 to 3 feet tall and average about 30 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Picking Claws
entries: Torans don't have hands, but their claws are dextrous enough to handle small complex tasks. Toran can pick up weapons but can't use them in combat.

entries.name: Attuned Flight
entries: You have a flying speed of 40 feet. To use this speed, you must attune to the Way of Worlds by act of sacrificing an attunement slot. Attuning to flight takes the same amount of time and follows the same restrictions as attuning to a magic item.

entries.name: Song & Dance
entries: You have proficiency with your claws, which are a finesse weapon that deal {@dice 1d8} slashing damage.

entries.name: Dazzling Plummage
entries: As a bonus action you can double your proficiency bonus on any Charisma skill check. After using this ability you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Ancient Melody
entries: You gain proficiency with your voice, which you can use to sing a variety of melodies that instill a magical effect by manifesting the nature of Arvandor.

As an action, you sing a peaceful and enchanting haiku to a creature within 30 feet of you. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw with a DC equal to your melody save DC (8 + your Charisma modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, that creature must use an action on their next turn to give you the final verse. After they do so, their turn immediately ends, and they cannot take reactions until the end of their next turn.
Once you use this ability, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Toran, and Auran.

entries.name: Age
entries: Half-Forged age at virtually the same rate as Humans, although they live a bit longer, with the oldest of them being around one-hundred and thirty years old.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Half-Forged tend toward no particular alignment. The best and the worst are found among them.

entries.name: Size
entries: Half-Forged vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

entries.name: Cybernetic Implants
entries: All Half-Forged have been modified from their original race in some way, with these cybernetics varying immensely. You can select 4 cybernetic traits of your choice from the following list:

{@b Implanted Weapon.} You have a one-handed ranged or melee weapon that you are proficient with hidden under your skin. This weapon has the properties it would normally have, and the Concealed property if it didn’t have it already. Drawing this weapon is an item interaction. You may swap out the weapon implanted in this way at the completion of a long rest. This implant may be chosen twice.

{@b Cybernetic Reflexes.} Your reflexes have been cybernetically enhanced, allowing you to send your senses into a heighted fidelity for a limited time as time seems to slow around you. You may take the {@action Dodge} action as a bonus action an amount of times equal to half your proficiency bonus, rounded down. You regain all expended uses on a long rest.

{@b Reinforced Bones.} Your skeleton and/or skin has been reinforced and/or covered with an experimental, organic version of steel, increasing your durability exponentially. As a reaction to when you are hit by an attack, you can increase your AC by 2 until the end of your next turn. You may use this reaction an amount of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses on a long rest.

{@b Automated Defense Systems.} You have been implanted with defense systems that are programmed to defend you when you would otherwise be unable to defend yourself. If you are attacked by a creature while you are {@condition unconscious}, {@condition incapacitated}, {@condition stunned}, or {@condition paralyzed}, your defenses will momentarily take control of your body. You may make one melee or ranged weapon attack against the attacking creature before the attack resolves if they are within range or your reach. Your Automated Defense Systems can activate a number of times equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded down), and you regain all expended uses on a long rest.

{@b Propulsion Systems.} You have outfitted your arms and/or legs with low power propulsion units, allowing you to take flight temporarily through the power of science. As a bonus action, you may manifest these systems. You gain a flight speed equal to your walking speed, though you must end your turn on a solid surface. Otherwise, your propulsion systems will sputter out, and you fall to the ground at the end of your turn. You may activate your propulsion systems a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses on a short or long rest.

{@b Threat Detector.} You have implanted an experimental set of sensors within your parietal lobe, sensors that subconsciously evaluate the environment and creatures around you without any input from you. If you are surprised at the beginning of combat, and aren’t incapacitated, you can immediately expend an amount of movement up to your maximum in an attempt to escape harm.

{@b Microgenerator.} You have implanted a small, high-voltage generator within your circulatory system that packs a shocking punch. When you are reduced to a quarter of your HP (rounded down), you may use a reaction to unleash an electroshock in a ten foot radius. All creatures within that radius must make a Strength saving throw equal to 8 + proficiency bonus + Constitution modifier or be pushed back ten feet and knocked {@condition prone}. Once you use this implant, you must complete a long rest before using it again.

{@b Biomonitor.} Your circulatory system has been modified with a biomonitor, which keeps track of and sends a chemical agent into your bloodstream at your beck and call. As a reaction to taking damage, you may inject yourself with a potion you have preloaded into your Biomonitor system. You may pour a potion into your Biomonitor by pouring it into a port within your arm as an action. The potion may not be withdrawn after being poured out into the Biomonitor system.

{@b Titanium Bones.} Going a step further than simply applying a coating to your skeleton or skin, you have reinforced yourself with pure titanium. You are considered one size larger than you are for the purposes of determining carrying capacity and the amount you can push, drag, or lift.

{@b Optical Implants.} You have opted to replace your organic eyes with cybernetic versions, enhancing and honing your senses far beyond what a normal creature could ever hope to achieve. In conditions of clear visibility, you can make out details of even extremely distant creatures and objects as small as 2 feet across. You have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can also see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

{@b Vibrosensor.} You have implanted yourself with a finely tuned audio implant that can pick up and detect vibrations that would normally be imperceptible to an ordinary organic creature. As a bonus action, you can tune into this sensor. You gain tremorsense out to 30 feet until the end of your next turn. You may use this sensor an amount of times equal to your proficiency bonus before it must recharge. You regain all expended uses on a long rest.

{@b Internal Defibrillator.} You have been outfitted with the most top of line implant in self-preservation, an internal defibrillator. Implanted near your heart, this implant passively monitors your vitals and comes into play when it would detect your imminent demise. When you would die from failing three death saving throws, an electric jolt is sent into your heart, stabilizing you on the spot and saving you from certain death. Once activated, you must complete a long rest before this implant recharges.

{@b Burst Joints.} The muscles in your legs have been modified using light metals and pneumatics. Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet. In addition, you can take the {@action Dash} action as a bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency modifier, and regain all expended uses on a long rest.

{@b High-Intelligence Chip.} You gain one language or one skill of your choice, in addition to proficiency in one weapon of your choice. You can also expend a use of this ability to gain advantage on one skill check you have proficiency. You have a number uses of this ability equal to your proficiency modifier, and regain all expended uses on a long rest.

{@b Wavecutter.} Your legs have been enhanced with a pneumatic pressure-inducing system that exudes intense propulsive forces with the goal of propelling you at high speeds underwater. You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one language of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: After achieving sentience, starforged mature at the same age as humans. They can live until their cores run out of energy, a process that can take up to 700 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most starforged take comfort in order and discipline, tending toward law and neutrality, but some have absorbed the morality—or lack thereof—of the beings they served with.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is Medium. Most starforged stand between 5 and 6½ feet tall.

entries.name: Luminous Core
entries: You know the {@spell light} cantrip, and can cast it as a bonus action. Constitution is your spellcasting modifier for it.

entries.name: Born From Stone
entries: Your cosmic nature as an organic, lithiod creature grants you the following benefits:

items: Your creature type is elemental, rather than humanoid.
You have resistance to cold damage.
You are immune to disease.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.
You don't need to sleep and don't suffer the effects of exhaustion due to lack of rest, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: Your body is composed of metal, stone, and strands of starlight. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Sentry's Rest
entries: When you take a long rest, you must spend at least six hours of it in an inactive, motionless state, rather than sleeping. In this state, you appear inert, but it doesn't render you {@condition unconscious}, and you can see and hear as normal.

entries.name: Lithiod Transparency
entries: While you remain motionless, you are indistinguishable from an ordinary rock formation.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: With the proper replacement parts and activities to occupy yourself, you can conceivably exist indefinitely. Nasods are known to degrade and lose their sanity, however, if they live too long without an explicit purpose. It is not known if this insanity visits all Nasods at old age, or just those whose resolve wavers.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Nasods possess mechanical minds, which find logic comforting. Generally, Nasods are lawful.

entries.name: Size
entries: As constructs modified by self-aware machines, Nasods could conceivably be perfectly uniform, like the Warforged that preceded them. However, the Foundries are either inherently flawed, or otherwise have a fondness for making diverse units, for each created Nasod is in some way unique. Nasod units stand between 5 and 7 feet tall and average about 150 to 300 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Created by Code
entries: Even though you were constructed, you are a living creature, represented by the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}, and you have resistance to poison damage.
You are immune to disease.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe, and can survive in a vacuum.

Instead of sleeping, you enter an inactive state for 4 hours each day. You do not dream in this state; you are fully aware of your surroundings and notice approaching enemies and other events as normal.
You can still be placed into a torpor by sleep-inducing magic.

entries.name: Thermal Vision
entries: Equipped with a heat-detecting thermal vision system beneath your eyelids, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades representative of thermal vision.

entries.name: Mind Over Matter
entries: Your mechanical mind is inherently logical, and is not easily swayed. You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}.

entries.name: Made to Assemble
entries: You gain one skill proficiency of your choice and one {@book tool|phb|5|tools} proficiency of your choice.

entries.name: On the Line
entries: You know the {@spell mending} cantrip, and your casting time for this spell is an action. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it. You can cast {@spell mending} as an action a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier, and regain all expended uses on a short or long rest. While you have no remaining uses, the casting time of {@spell mending} becomes a minute.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Neural.

entries.name: It's Just Anti-Freeze
entries: You have resistance to cold damage. In addition, you do not suffer any ill effects from extreme cold or heat.

entries.name: Autonomous Blaster Device
entries: You can cast the {@spell magic missile} spell with a 2nd-level spell slot once with this trait, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: Born in the Future
entries: You gain one exotic weapon or firearm proficiency.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Neural.

entries.name: Orbital Shield
entries: You have resistance to force damage.

entries.name: Modern Magic
entries: You know the {@spell on/off} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell expeditious retreat} spell once per day. At 5th level, you can cast the {@spell levitate} spell once per day. Intelligence or Wisdom (your choice) is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Lightning Magnet
entries: As an action at the beginning of your turn, you can assume the form of lightning by breaking your physical form apart into all its components. Until the beginning of your next turn, you can take no actions, bonus actions, or reactions. In addition, you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, lightning, and thunder damage. You also ignore difficult terrain. After using this ability, you can use it again after you take a short or long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Neural.

entries.name: From the Oceans
entries: You gain a swimming speed of 30 feet.

entries.name: Neural Synapses
entries: Using gestures and sounds, you can communicate simple ideas with Small or smaller beasts that have an inborn swimming speed.

entries.name: Rough Plating
entries: Your plating digs into the skin of those who attempt to grab you, forcing them to exchange the position of their hands constantly to avoid stabbing themselves. You have advantage on all checks to resist or escape a grapple.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Neural, and Aquan.

entries.name: Age
entries: Demihumans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Demiumans tend toward no particular alignment. The best and the worst are found among them.

entries.name: Size
entries: Demihumans vary widely in height and build, from barely 4 feet to well over 7 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Choose one of the abilities you did not increase between Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma. That ability score increases by 1.

entries.name: Birth From Creation
entries: All Demihumans are radically different from one another, depending on the changes than manifested within them from birth. You can select 4 breed traits of your choice from the following list:
{@b Adept Climber.} Gain proficiency in your choice of {@skill Athletics} or {@skill Acrobatics}. You have a climb speed equivalent to your walking speed.
{@b Beast of Burden.} You are considered one size larger than you are for the purposes of determining carrying capacity and the amount you can push, drag, or lift.

{@b Echolocation.} As a bonus action on your turn you can emit a shriek inaudible to creatures without this trait. Until the end of your next turn you have blindsight up to 30 feet away while you are not {@condition deafened}.

{@b Darkvision.} Accustomed to life underground or the night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

{@b Attuned Flight.} You have a flying speed of 30 feet. To use this speed, you must attune to the Way of Worlds by act of sacrificing an attunement slot. Attuning to flight takes the same amount of time and follows the same restrictions as attuning to a magic item.
{@b Jumper.} Gain proficiency in your choice of {@skill Athletics} or {@skill Acrobatics}. Your long jump is up to 25 feet and your high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.
{@b Keen Senses.} Gain proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill and choose one sense (sight, smell, taste, temperature, or touch). You gain advantage on Perception rolls that utilize that sense.

{@b Kin of Mine.} Gain proficiency in {@skill Animal Handling}. Your proficiency bonus is doubled when you make an {@skill Animal Handling} check. In addition, you have two creature types: humanoid and beast. You can be affected by a spell or ability that works on either of your creature types.
{@b Longstrider.} Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.
{@b Natural Armor.} When you aren’t wearing armor, your AC equals 12 + your Constitution or Dexterity modifier (your choice).
{@b Natural Talent.} Beasts of the earth, sky, and sea have talents as varied as their shapes. You gain proficiency in a skill of your choice.

{@b Natural Weapon.} You have a natural weapon that you are proficient in (this could be a bite, claw, quill, club tail, or other bestial feature). This natural weapon is a finesse weapon that deals {@dice 1d4} bludgeoning, piercing, poison, or slashing damage (your choice).
{@b Born From Waves.} You have a swim speed equivalent to your walking speed and can breathe in air and water.
{@b Regeneration.} Whenever you complete a short rest, you can roll one {@dice d6} if you expended any hit dice. Add the result to the total health you gain.

{@b Relentless.} When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can use a reaction to drop to 1 hit point instead. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

{@b Chameleon.} You have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks if you have not moved during the current turn. In addition, you can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

entries.name: Language
entries: You begin with Common and Beastspeech. Beastspeech can only be learned by Demis and, when speaking it, they can communicate with the animal they resemble as if under the effect of the spell, {@spell speak with animals}. For example, a sheep demihuman could speak with sheep.

entries.name: Age
entries: Pandarian mature at the same rate as humans, but they're considered young until they reach the age of 50. On average, they live about 350 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: Pandarian are between 7 feet to 8 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most Pandarian are lawful, believing firmly in the benefits of a well-ordered society. They tend toward good as well, with a strong sense of fair play and a belief that everyone deserves to share in the benefits of a just order.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries: Accustomed to hunting for edible food, your nose has developed a sharp intiution. You gain proficiency in {@skill Perception} checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Gourmand
entries: Pandarian are excellent cooks and brewers, and take great care in traversing their terrain to find the most excellent of ingreidents. You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed, and you are proficient in cook's utensils and brewer's supplies.

entries.name: Between Worlds
entries: You have two creature types: humanoid and beast. You can be affected by a spell or ability that works on either of your creature types.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Choose one of the abilities you did not increase between Intelligence or Wisdom. That ability score increases by 1.

entries.name: Sagely Knowledge
entries: Your vast mind has been irreversibly linked to the that of the Tree of Life, a mystical artifact that exists in-between the boundaries of both space and time. Each branch of the tree tells a story, and each leaf holds boundless knowledge, tangientally awaiting your access of it.

As a Pandarian with access to this vast network of information, you have advantage on saving throws against the {@condition charmed} condition. In addition, you may activate your Sagely Knowledge feature as a reaction in response to one of the following conditions:

items: When you would be required to make a {@skill History} check to discover information about a specific topic, event, or location. Upon activating your Sagely Knowledge feature, you immediately pass the check.

When you would engage in conversation with another creature in a language that you yourself are not practiced in. Upon activating your Sagely Knowledge feature, you understand the literal and nuanced implications of that language, and can read, write, and speak it fluently for one hour.
When you would suffer from the effects of madness. Upon activating your Sagely Knowledge feature, you are not put under the effects of madness.

entries: You may use your Sagely Knowledge feature twice, and afterwards, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again. You regain all expended uses on a long rest.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Sylvan, and one additional language of your choice.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Choose one of the abilities you did not increase between Strength or Constitution. That ability score increases by 1.

entries.name: Sagely Authority
entries: You have gain an inherent mastery over the ancient arts of Pandarian combat, an artform that has not been practiced for many milennia. Whether this gift was an act of divine providence or a manifestation of your bloodlines's inert traits, it is impossible to determine. What is possible to determine, however, is that you are remarkably proficient in unconviential combat styles.
As a recepient of the ancient Pandarian arts, you confer the following benefits:

items: Simple and martial weapons without the thrown property can be treated as if they had the thrown property. One-handed weapons have a range of 20/60, while two-handed weapons have a range of 15/30.
Whenever you make a thrown weapon attack using a light weapon, the weapon immediately boomerangs back into your grasp without requiring an object interaction.

At the start of your turn before you would expend movement, you can declare that you will move via transference of kinetic motion. Your current movement speed is instead swapped for your climbing speed (even if you are not currently climbing, so long as you are not swimming, flying, or burrowing). You then proceed to curl up into a dense, cataclysmic ball of unwavering force. If you move at least 20 feet toward a target and then hit it with a melee weapon attack on the same turn, that target is knocked back 5 feet for every 20 feet you traveled before the attack.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Sylvan, and one additional language of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: Aftuan are theoretically immortal, but subsist off their legends in ancient folktales and stories. In order to continue their furrowed existence, they must continue to spread their creeping fear. A fear that can only be described as the fear of the unknown.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Aftuan are connected directly to Chaos, but this does not mean they're chaotic. Instead, their ability to view things from all aspects as Chaos guides them allows the Aftuan to take a uniquely true neutral approach to the world.

entries.name: Size
entries: Aftuan are between 5 feet to 8 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Your eyes give you superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, you only see in shades of blue.

entries.name: Alien Mind
entries: Unnatural. Unconventional. As an aftuan, your existence is beyond this world's boundaries. Your creature type is aberrant, rather than humanoid. In addition, you gain access to the following benefits as per your aberrant nature:

items: You have resistance to psychic damage.
You have advantage on saving throws against the {@condition frightened} and {@condition charmed} conditions.
You cannot suffer from the effects of madness.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe, and can survive in a vacuum.
You don't need to sleep and don't suffer the effects of {@condition exhaustion} due to lack of rest, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Whispers in the Beyond
entries: You learn the {@spell vicious mockery} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell dissonant whispers} spell once per day. At 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell crown of madness} spell once per day. Intelligence or Charisma is your spellcasting modifier for these spells (your choice).

entries.name: Limited Telepathy
entries: You can speak telepathically to other creatures within 60 feet. However, you can only speak Deep Speech this way, and creatures who don't speak Deep Speech can only make out distant, haunting whispers. The exception are creatures under the effects of Long-Term or Indefinite Madness, who can make out your words clearly, regardless of their known languages.

entries.name: Eyes of the Void
entries: You know if a creature within 300 feet of you that you can see is suffering from the effects of Madness. If you detect a creature with this feature, you also know what short-term or indefinite Madness effect, if any, they're suffering from (some creatures can simply be mad, and if so, what instead returns to you is a garble of various signs with no coherent pattern).

You can also detect if a creature's Madness has granted them a disability not on the Madness table (with your DMs permission). Disabilities that can result from Madness can include but are not limited to: OCD, dual personality disorder, and stockholm syndrome.

entries.name: Otherworldly Appendages
entries: Aftuan are birthed with four illithid tentactles that can manifest from any part of their body. Your additional appendages allow you to interact with an additional object or feature of the environment for free on your turn. You may not carry and use shields for defense with these additional appendages. Nor do they grant you additional attacks, or allow you to wield weapons with them for combat.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Deep Speech. In addition, you learn how to read Qualith.

entries.name: Age
entries: Changelings mature slightly faster than humans but share a similar lifespan—typically a century or less. While a changeling can shapeshift to conceal their age, the effects of aging still catch up to them.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Changelings hate to be bound in any way, and those who follow the path of the Traveler believe that chaos and change are important aspects of life. Most tend toward pragmatic neutrality as opposed to being concerned with lofty ideals. Few changelings embrace evil.

entries.name: Size
entries: In their natural forms, changelings average between 5 and 6 feet in height, with a slender build. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Change Appearance
entries: As an action, you can transform your appearance or revert to your natural form. You can't duplicate the appearance of a creature you've never seen, and you revert to your natural form if you die.

You decide what you look like, including your height, weight, facial features, the sound of your voice, coloration, hair length, sex, and any other distinguishing characteristics. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your game statistics change. You also can't appear as a creature of a different size than you, and your basic shape stays the same; if you're bipedal, you can't use this trait to become quadrupedal, for instance. Your clothing and other equipment don't change in appearance, size, or shape to match your new form, requiring you to keep a few extra outfits on hand to make the most compelling disguise possible.

Even to the most astute observers, your ruse is usually indiscernible. If you rouse suspicion, or if a wary creature suspects something is amiss, you have advantage on any Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check you make to avoid detection.

entries.name: Changeling Instincts
entries: You gain proficiency with two of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Deception}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Intimidation}, or {@skill Persuasion}

entries.name: Unsettling Visage
entries: When a creature you can see makes an attack roll against you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the roll. You must use this feature before knowing whether the attack hits or misses. Using this trait reveals your shapeshifting nature to any creature within 30 feet that can see you. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Divergent Persona
entries: You gain proficiency with one {@book tool|phb|5|tools} of your choice. Define a persona associated with that proficiency: establish the name, race, gender, age, and other details. While you are in the form of this persona, the related proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses that proficiency.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and two other languages of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: The Beneath live up to two hundred years after the time they ascended, sustained by the unholy powers that mutated them, before the dark energies fizzle out and the creature perishes.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: The bloodlust that lives within all Beneath drives them toward evil, but the strong willed can maintain a neutral disposition. A rare, exceptional few can even become good.

entries.name: Size
entries: The Beneath are between 10 feet to 14 feet tall, although as a quadruped, their height can deminish to as low as 6 to 7 feet when running. Your size is Large.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Ankheg's Tremorsense
entries: You have tremorsense up to 10 feet. As an action which lasts for one minute, you can extend your tremorsense to 40 feet. You can only use this feature twice per short rest.

entries.name: Arctic Regeneration
entries: Whenever you complete a short rest, you can roll one {@dice d6} for each hit die you expend. Add the result to the total health you gain.

entries.name: Umber Hulk's Burrowing
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend up to your current movement speed to burrow underground, traveling to a destination within range. While you are burrowing, you are considered to be under the effects of full-cover. After using this feature, you decide whether you'll emerge on the current turn, or the turn after you start to burrow.
Regardless of when you arrive at your destination, you cannot use this feature again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: Monstrous
entries: Your creature type is monstrosity, rather than humanoid.

entries.name: Deadly Leap
entries: Your long jump is up to 25 feet and your high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start. If you jump at least 15 feet as part of your movement, you can use an attack action to slam on the ground in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a Strength or Dexterity saving throw equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier. On a failed save, those creatures are knocked {@condition prone} and take {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage. This damage increases to 2d6 at 5th level, 3d6 at 10th level, 4d6 at 15th level, and 5d6 at 20th level. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Terran.

entries.name: Age
entries: The lifespan of a psion largely depends on how direct a connection they share with the immortal God-Emperor, Psion. Those who reside on Dayberth may expect a life that exceeds well-past three-hundred years of age, whereas those who serve as leaders for the imperial meritocracy have been said to live upwards of a thousand. Those who denounce their citizenry, however, are said to have the weakest lifespans, living for a scant hundred years before wilting.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: The psions reside on Dayberth, a nation predicated on their beliefs of equal opportunity and spiritualistic ideals. Their alignment leans towards good.

entries.name: Size
entries: Psions are between 6 feet to 9 feet tall, a factor that depends entirely on their plant genus. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Blessed by the God-Emperor
entries: Your creature type is plant, rather than humanoid. In addition, you gain access to the following benefits and negatives as per your nature as a citizen of Dayberth:

items: You can speak telepathically to any creature you can see, provided the creature is within a number of feet of you equal to 10 times your level. You don't need to share a language with the creature for it to understand your telepathic utterances, but the creature must be able to understand at least one language.
You cannot speak any language. Your only method of communication is your telepathy.

You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe. However, you must absorb at least five hours of moonlight a day in order to continue normal functionality. When you attempt to long rest after having not had access to ample moonlight, any healing you receive from rolling hit die is divided by half.
You have advantage on all Wisdom saving throws.
You have resistance to psychic damage.

entries: Unfortunately, while psions are still considered plantoids in nature, the psion species has far elevated past their pure plant brethren, and thus do not maintain the ability to speak with plants without further specialization.

entries.name: Wilting Rose
entries: As an action, the foliage which makes up your form begins to writhe and convulse, causing your chest to collapse inwards and opening up your Mind's Eye: a red, ethereal pupil with the iris of a snake and dark-red sclera.

For the next minute, you can use an action to force a creature within 30 feet of you to make a Wisdom saving throw with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier. On a failed save, that creature is assaulted with malefic visions of a future without the God-Emperor. Until the end of their next turn, that creature becomes {@condition incapacitated}.
While your Mind's Eye is open, you gain the following weaknesses:

items: You no longer have advantage on all Wisdom saving throws, as per your Blessed by the God-Emperor feature.
You no longer have resistance to psychic damage, as per your Blessed by the God-Emperor feature.
You gain vulnerability to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

entries: Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can read and write Common, Deep Speech, and one additional language of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: Imbued with magic, awakened age more slowly and typically live much longer than their unawakened counterparts. They reach adulthood after a year but can live for as long as 60 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Awakened will generally adopt the alignment of their owner, if they have any. Without an owner, an awakened upbringing can be radically different, as a result of the instinctual urges various breeds of awakened have. The best and worst exist among their ranks.

entries.name: Size
entries: Awakened wolves are different from their fellow awakened bretheren. Enhanced by the feral DNA of a dire wolf alongside the gait of a lumbering predator, you tower above your kin in quite a remarkable way. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Beastly
entries: Your creature type is beast, rather than humanoid.

entries.name: You Are an Animal
entries: Awakened don't have hands, but their arms (depending on the breed) are dextrous enough to handle small complex tasks. Awakened can pick up weapons but can't use them in combat.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Bite
entries: Your carnivorous canines are a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. On a hit, you deal slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the typical bludgeoning damage of an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Dire Visage
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Intimidation} skill. In addition, you can release a threatening growl as an action, unleashing the dire gene within you in a burst of demonic energy.

All hostile creatures within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Charisma modifier (your choice). On a failed save, those creatures fall {@condition prone} and become {@condition frightened} for one minute. A creature frightened by this feature can remake the save at the start of each of their turns, ending the effect on a success. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Blessed by the Wolf God
entries: Your kind has been remarkably blessed by the Wolf God, granting you abilities which complement your identity as an awakened animal. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your base walking speed increases to 40 feet.
Shadows are your leverage. You ignore the effects of difficult terrain while in dim light or darkness.
You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.
You have resistance to necrotic damage.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: As creatures who partake in the giant's kin, half-ogres lifespans run long if they do not sacrifice their years in a wartorn lifestyle. Half-Ogres reach adulthood at 20, and the oldest of them can live for upwards of 500 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: Half-Ogres are between 12 to 16 feet tall. Your size is Large.

entries.name: Kin of Giant
entries: Your creature type is giant, rather than humanoid.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Big Leg
entries: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

entries.name: Immutable Tum-Tum
entries: Your stomach is incredibly hardy, designed to handle...rough ingestion (you were told not to look up the history of your ancestors, and you're taking that statement to heart).

While your stomach is guilt-free of any crime, you are able to swallow quite unnatural things. You gain resistance to poison and advantage against the {@condition poisoned} condition, and can digest and gain nutrients from "food" you should otherwise be unable to, such as: rocks, leaves, grass, dirt, gravel, and on occasion, rats (those dirty, dirty marsupials).
Digesting these items does not cause dysentery or sickness (but they may induce some mean flatulence).

entries.name: Heavy Rock Go Brrrrrrrrr
entries: As an admittedly dim member of the giantkin family, you have grown accustomed to utilizing unconventional, convenient weapons in order to protect your homestead (which essentially means you use large, heavy rocks).

You can lift and carry any Medium to Large object or structure which weighs less than 200 pounds that is easily-detachable without incurring any encumberment penalties. In addition, if that object weighs between 100 and 200 pounds, you can chuck it at an enemy within 30 feet of you as part of an Attack action.

That creature must roll a Dexterity saving throw with a DC of 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier. On a failed save, that creature takes {@dice 1d10} damage and is knocked {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Fight or Fight
entries: As a reaction to another creature making any statement, you can make a DC 12 Intelligence check. On a failed check, you find a preconceived insult in that creature's declaration, regardless if that creature actually supplied an insult in their statement.

You then fly into a vehement rage as your inherent short fuses leads you to violence. While in this state, you gain a +2 damage rolls you make with melee weapons for one minute. Once you go into this rage, you cannot use this ability again until you complete a short or long rest.
This bonus increases to +4 at 11th level and +6 at 17th level.

entries.name: Wartorn Past
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Athletics} skill.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can read and write Common and Giant.

entries.name: Age
entries: Centaurs mature at around the same rate as elves, but live for somewhat less time, the oldest of most being around 600 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Centaurs are inclined toward chaos, seeing no need for rules and regulations on their freedom; however, their actions still aim to be noble and just, drawing them towards good. The shy Crystalmir share these traits; the terrible Endscapes lean into evil, while Wendles are usually neither good nor evil.

entries.name: Size
entries: Centaurs stand between 6 to well over 7 feet tall, with their equine bodies ranging between 4 to 5 feet at the whithers. Wendles usually sit at a smaller size of around only around 5 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base speed is 40 feet.

entries.name: Hybrid Nature
entries: You have two creature types: humanoid and monstrosity. You can be affected by a game effect if it works on either of your creature types.

entries.name: Hooves
entries: Your hooves are natural melee weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Equine Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push or drag.

In addition, any climb that requires hands and feet is especially difficult for you because of your equine legs. When you make such a climb, each foot of movement costs you 4 extra feet, instead of the normal 1 extra foot.

entries.name: Survivor
entries: You have proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: Animal Handling, Medicine, Nature, or Survival.

entries.name: Swift Rider
entries: You can use the Dash action as a bonus action.

entries.name: Charge
entries: If you move at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hit it with a melee weapon attack on the same turn, you can immediately follow that attack with a bonus action, making one attack against the target with your hooves.

entries.name: Endscape Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with the shortbow, light crossbow, scimitar, and net.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Sylvan.

entries.name: Spell Affinity
entries: One of your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma scores increase by 1, your choice. Additionally, if you chose Intelligence, you can choose one cantrip from the wizard spell list, using Intelligence as your spellcasting ability modifier; if you chose Wisdom, you can choose one cantrip from the druid spell list, using Wisdom as your spellcasting ability modifier; if you chose Charisma, you can choose one cantrip from the sorcerer spell list, using Charisma as your spellcasting ability modifier.

entries.name: Quick Thinking
entries: You can take the Search or Disengage action as a bonus action.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Sylvan.

entries.name: Extra Language
entries: You learn any additional language of your choosing.

entries.name: Age
entries: Minotaurs mature at about 17, and can live to be almost 200 years old.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Minotaurs tend toward lawful and neutral alignments, but rarely chaos. Like humans, the best and the worst are found among them.

entries.name: Size
entries: Minotaurs have variable sizing, standing anywhere between 6 to almost 9 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Hybrid Nature.
entries: You have two creature types: humanoid and monstrosity. You can be affected by a game effect if it works on either of your creature types.

entries.name: Darkvision.
entries: Due to your many nights on the sea and your monstrous ancestry, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Minotaur Armor Training
entries: You gain proficiency with light and medium armor.

entries.name: Mariner
entries: While you aren't wearing heavy armor or using a shield, you can use your bonus action to gain either a swim speed or climbing speed of 40 feet until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Seabound Soul
entries: You gain proficiency with vehicles (water) and navigator's tools.

entries.name: Horns
entries: Your horns are natural melee weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Martial Maneuvering
entries: You have advantage on any roll to avoid being grappled.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Giant.

entries.name: Conquerer's Knowledge
entries: Knowledge. You have proficiency in the History and Religion skills.

entries.name: Seafarer's Footing
entries: You have advantage on any roll to avoid being knocked prone.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Giant.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid.

entries.name: Gem Ancestry
entries: You trace your ancestry to a gem dragon, granting you a special magical affinity. Choose one type of dragon from the Gem Ancestry table. This determines the damage type for your other traits as shown in the table.

entries.name: Breath Weapon
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of a magical energy in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw against a DC equal to 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. A creature takes {@dice 2d8} damage of the type associated with your Gem Ancestry on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. This damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 3d8}), 11th level ({@dice 4d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 5d8}).
You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Draconic Resistance
entries: You have resistance to the damage type associated with your Gem Ancestry.

entries.name: Psionic Mind
entries: You can telepathically speak to any creature you can see within 30 feet of you. You don't need to share a language with the creature, but the creature must be able to understand at least one language. Your communication doesn't give the creature the ability to respond to you telepathically.

entries.name: Gem Flight
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use your bonus action to temporarily summon an array of spectral gems that match your Gem Ancestry in the shape of wings that last for 1 minute. For the duration, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid.

entries.name: Chromatic Ancestry
entries: You trace your ancestry to a chromatic dragon, granting you a special magical affinity. Choose one type of dragon from the Chromatic Ancestry table. This determines the damage type for your other traits as shown in the table.

entries.name: Breath Weapon
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of a magical energy in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw against a DC equal to 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. A creature takes {@dice 2d8} damage of the type associated with your Chromatic Ancestry on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. This damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 3d8}), 11th level ({@dice 4d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 5d8}).
You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Draconic Resistance
entries: You have resistance to the damage type associated with your Chromatic Ancestry.

entries.name: Chromatic Warding
entries: Starting at 3rd level, as an action, you can channel your draconic energies to protect yourself. For 10 minutes, you become immune to the damage type associated with your Chromatic Ancestry. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid.

entries.name: Metallic Ancestry
entries: You trace your ancestry to a metallic dragon, granting you a special magical affinity. Choose one type of dragon from the Metallic Ancestry table. This determines the damage type for your other traits as shown in the table.

entries.name: Breath Weapon
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of a magical energy in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw against a DC equal to 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. A creature takes {@dice 2d8} damage of the type associated with your Metallic Ancestry on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. This damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 3d8}), 11th level ({@dice 4d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 5d8}).
You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Draconic Resistance
entries: You have resistance to the damage type associated with your Metallic Ancestry.

entries.name: Metallic Breath Weapon
entries: At 3rd level you gain a second breath weapon. When you take the {@action Attack} action, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of a magical gas in a 15-foot cone. The save DC for this breath is 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. When you use this ability, choose one:

items: Each creature in the area must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 20 feet away from you and be knocked {@condition prone}.
Each creature in the area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition incapacitated} until the start of your next turn.

entries: Once you use your Metallic Breath Weapon, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic.

entries.name: Age
entries: Granted sentience by the will of the Disparity Daemon, the blessings attributed to archslime allow them to age similarly to humans, though after reaching adulthood, their aging process ceases. Archslimes are known to diminish in power and lose their sanity, however, if they live too long without an explicit purpose.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: While Archslime are not directly subservient to Obstract, the will which cemented their existence drives their nature towards that of neutrality. With freedom driving the archslime to pursuing the benefits of the human world, however, it is not uncommon for an archslime to break the mold, quite ironically leading deviancy to become the norm.

entries.name: Size
entries: Archslime tend to be the same size as regular humans, although their height and proportions differ based on how they have shaped their mold. In addition, archslime are genderless, instead choosing to base their mold off a human gender at birth. Not all archslimes practice this, however, and some make an effort in order to appear as non-binary as possible. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Disparity Blessing
entries: Your creature type is ooze, rather than humanoid. In addition, you gain access to the following benefits as per your ooze-like nature:

items: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}, and you have resistance to acid and poison damage.
You are immune to disease.
You don't need to breathe, but you must still ingest food and drink.

Instead of sleeping, you enter an inactive state for 4 hours each day. You do not dream in this state; you are fully aware of your surroundings and notice approaching enemies and other events as normal.

entries.name: Slippery Construct
entries: Your malleable, ooze-like body allows for quick morphing and dirty tricks on the fly. As an action, you can transform from your humanoid shape to a lumpy (and bulbous) amorphous form. When you do so, you determine whether your size remains the same or becomes Small, and you gain the following benefits:

items: Your movement speed is reduced by half, rounded down.
The {@condition restrained} condition is treated as the {@condition grappled} condition for you.
You can move through spaces as narrow as 1-inch wide without squeezing.
While you can create slime implements that are dextrous enough to handle small complex tasks, you cannot wield weapons or wear armor in this form.

entries.name: Bad Touch
entries: You can manifest an acidic substance from your body as a defense mechanism, turning your otherwise slippery exterior into a deadly weapon. Any creature that grapples you or otherwise comes into direct contact with your skin must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 1d6} acid damage. This damage does not apply to any unarmed strikes you make.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one additional language of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: Ghosts do not age. Given time, the necromantic energies that sustain you will heal most wounds you take at approximately the same rate as a mortal, and your hit die function as normal.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Many Ghosts cling to the alignment they held in their life, even if that life is but a distant memory in their minds. For others, the act of being reborn as a ghastly entity on the mortal coil changes them significantly, and they adopt a new worldview in light of what their transformation has taught them.

entries.name: Past Life
entries: Choose another race besides this one; the race you select must be humanoid and lack the Living Construct trait (or similar). Even after being transformed in the Ethereal Plane, you maintain vague memories of this past life as this race. Your size, height, and movement speed are the same as this race. You do not retain special movement speeds from this race (such as flying, climbing, or swimming), and you do not carry over any racial features. If your past race had subraces, select one, but you do not carry over any racial features from that either.

entries.name: Living Dead
entries: You have been brought back to the mortal coil, but your form has changed drastically. You are immune to disease. You do not need to eat or breathe (and can survive in a vacuum), but you can ingest food and drink if you wish. Additionally, you have two creature types: humanoid and undead. You can be affected by a spell or ability that works on either of your creature types.

entries.name: Holy Gospel
entries: After reviving in the Material Plane, you received a blessing through a deitic force. This force is not any specific deity or person, but rather a force of nature similar to a tornado or hurricane. Unlike other undead, you can be restored through healing magic, but it has a significantly dampened effect on you. When you regain hit points from a source that specifies it does not function on undead, you instead receive half as many hit points as the source would provide, rounded down, instead of none.

entries.name: Otherworldly Flight
entries: You gain a flying speed of 30 feet and can hover. To use this speed, you must attune to the Way of Worlds by act of sacrificing an attunement slot. Attuning to flight takes the same amount of time and follows the same restrictions as attuning to a magic item.
If you do not attune to the Way of Worlds, you can still fly using this feature. However, your maximum height is 5 feet. While flying this way, you can still hover.

entries.name: Deitic Force
entries: Your unarmed strikes deal radiant or necrotic damage (your choice) instead of bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Incorporeal Stride
entries: You are a partial existence—not quite alive, not quite dead. While you maintain the powers generally known to spirits, they come with a handful of restrictions befitting of someone between worlds.

While out-of-combat, you can move through other creatures and objects other than physical barriers (such as walls, floors, or ceilings) as if they were difficult terrain. You can pass through up to 10 feet of physical barriers (treating them as difficult terrain) as a part of your movement. If you end your turn inside an object or barrier, you take {@dice 1d10} force damage and are immediately ejected to the closest available space.

While you are in-combat, the stresses placed on your body causes passing through physical barriers this way to become difficult to perform. You can use this feature in-combat a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses on a long rest.
Even if you run out of in-combat uses of this feature, you can continue to pass through physical barriers out-of-combat without penalty.

entries.name: Intangible
entries: You have advantage on all checks to resist or escape a grapple.

entries.name: Invoke Smite
entries: You can instill power into the weapon of a nearby creature to strike with divine energy. As an bonus action, you touch the weapon of a creature within 30 feet of you.

Until the end of your next turn, the next time that creature succeeds on a melee weapon attack with that weapon, it deals an additional {@dice 1d8} radiant damage or {@dice 1d8} necrotic damage (your choice). Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Spirit Binding
entries: As a Spirit, your ghastly form is not completely realized, and require an anchor to maintain your existence in the Material Plane. You must select an object or creature of your choice (it could be a heirloom, weapon, or ally) to bind to indefinitely.
• You must remain within 150 feet of your bound target at all times, and if the object leaves your 150 foot radius, you are dragged along with it.
• You are always aware of where your bound target is in relation to you.
• Should the object be destroyed or the creature slain, you immediately drop to 0 hit points.

• If you regain consciousness without a spirit bond, you must immediately select a new object or creature within 150 feet to bind to. If no items or creatures are present within 150 feet, you are {@condition paralyzed} until one comes within 150 feet of you.

entries.name: Home Sweet Home
entries: As an action, you leap inside your bound target, storing away the remnants of your consciousness into a small demiplane which persists inside your anchor.

While inside your bound target, you can see from its perspective with your vision, and your physical body is considered to be {@condition invisible}. You cannot move or perform any actions in this state, other than taking an action to leave your bound target.
While your physical form cannot be seen, creatures can still target you without penalty for the benefit of spells, features, or attacks so long as the opposing creature can see your bound target.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and two other languages of your choice.

entries.name: Incorporeal Stride
entries: You are a partial existence—not quite alive, not quite dead. While you maintain the powers generally known to spirits, they come with a handful of restrictions befitting of someone between worlds.

While out-of-combat, you can move through other creatures and objects other than physical barriers (such as walls, floors, or ceilings) as if they were difficult terrain. You can pass through up to 10 feet of physical barriers (treating them as difficult terrain) as a part of your movement. If you end your turn inside an object or barrier, you take {@dice 1d10} force damage and are immediately ejected to the closest available space.

While you are in-combat, the stresses placed on your body causes passing through physical barriers this way to become difficult to perform. You can use this feature in-combat a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses on a long rest.
Even if you run out of in-combat uses of this feature, you can continue to pass through physical barriers out-of-combat without penalty.

entries.name: Ethereal Glare
entries: As a bonus action, choose a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. This creature must make a Wisdom saving throw against a DC of 8 + your Charisma modifier + your proficiency bonus. If it fails, this creature becomes frightened of you until the end of your next turn. Once you use this ability successfully, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: Canopic Chamber
entries: Chained to your soul is your physical body, which lies dormant in a sacrophagus until the time of your True Resurrection. This sacrophagus is located on the Ethereal Plane, and follows you within a 50 foot radius as you move along the Material Plane. Your body remaining alive is what allows your soul to reflect against the Material Plane as a humanoid shell for your actions.

If at any point your real body is destroyed, with the result making it so you are unable to sustain your continued existence, you soul immediately vanishes from the Material Plane. Following that, you immediately take Aeon damage equal to your maximum hit points (including temporary hit points), and your cease to remain within the collective conscious of humanity.

During a period of one hundred years after this event, memories of your existence will slowly begin to disappear from the minds of even your closest comrades, until eventually your life is completely wiped from annals of all non-magical storage.
• Your sacrophagus is bound to the Ethereal Plane by a deitic force and cannot be moved to a separate plane by any means.
• Your sacrophagus is locked shut by ethereal chains, although they can be opened with a DC 25 thieves' tools check.
• If your sacrophagus is unlocked, taking a short rest will relock it. This is represented by the ethereal chains needing time to reform.
• Your sacrophagus has an AC of 18 and hit points equal to a quarter of your maximum hit points.
• Any saving throws your true body or your sacrophagus makes are flat 1d20s.
• Your true body has an AC equal to 10 and hit points equal to your current maximum.
• Spells such as True Resurrection and Clone can only be cast on the body within your sacrophagus, and not your soul on the Material Plane.
• Your body within the sacrophagus is unconscious, but it is also immune to the following conditions: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained.
• No matter what plane you are on, you are aware if your true body is being attacked (but not if your sacrophagus is).
• Your true body cannot be separated from your sarcophagus.

entries.name: Canopic Resurrection
entries: While your soul is reflected against the Material Plane, your actual body resides on the Ethereal Plane. While your body remains safe and within its sarcophagus, you can reroll one death saving throw you have made. If you roll a 17 or higher on this rerolled saving throw, treat the result as if it was a natural 20. Once you reroll this saving throw, you must finish a short or long rest before you can do so again.

entries.name: Grasp from Beyond
entries: You can choose to make your unarmed strike deal force damage instead of bludgeoning damage, and any creature hit by your unarmed strike is unable to regain hit points until the end of your next turn. If a creature is reduced to 0 hit points by your unarmed strike, it instantly disintegrates into soul fumes, leaving behind any objects, clothing, or items on its person.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and two other languages of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: Like other fungi, myconids reproduce by mundane sporing. They carefully control their spores' release to avoid overpopulation. Individual myconids can live to well over a century. After this time, the most elder myconids can live even longer, becoming a Soverign of one or more circles and living up to a century longer.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most often, myconids believe strongly in society and law. It is extremely uncommon for a myconid to directly harm any creature that does not mean it, or its circle, harm. They are an incredibly passive and peaceful species.

entries.name: Size
entries: Myconids are between 5 feet to 6 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Fungi
entries: Your creature type is plant, rather than humanoid.

entries.name: Sun Sickness
entries: You become {@condition Poisoned} if you spend more than 1 minute in direct sunlight. This condition ends when you spend at least 1 minute in dim or dark conditions.

entries.name: Without a Voice
entries: Myconids lack proper biological constructs that can convey sound, and as such, they cannot speak language or interact verbally with other creatures. Though you have no conventional way to verbalize your thoughts, you may still cast spells that require verbal components.

entries.name: Rapport Spores
entries: Your spores can relay messages to you and to allies by sensing the synapses in a creature's mind. You can speak telepathically to any creature you can see, provided the creature is within a number of feet of you equal to 10 times your level. You don't need to share a language with the creature for it to understand your telepathic utterances, but the creature must be able to understand at least one language.

You can extend this benefit to a creature or multiple creatures as an action, allowing them to converse telepathically with you or with each other for a range of 15 feet. The creatures selected must have an Intelligence score of 2 or higher. Once the telepathic network is set up, said creatures do not need to share a language in order for them to understand each other's telepathic utterances, but they each must be able to understand at least one language.

entries.name: Pacifying Spores
entries: As an action, you can ejects spores at one creature you can see within 5 feet of you. The target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or become {@condition Charmed} for 1 minute. Undead, constructs, and elementals are unaffected by these spores. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After using this trait, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Hallucination Spores
entries: As an action, you can produce spores that effect all creatures within 30 feet of you that aren't undead, constructs, or elementals. You manifest the effects of the {@spell minor illusion} spell on the targeted creatures while you concentrate on this ability. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: Rejuvenating Spores
entries: As an action, you can disect the body of a deceased individual who died within the last hour in front of you taking that is not an undead, construct, or elemental. This process takes one minute and requires serene concentration, the completion of which produces a spore which you can give to yourself or an ally within 5 feet of you.

Upon receiving a spore, the creature receives {@dice 1d10} temporary hit points, and the body you were disecting decays into a fine yellow powder. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you take a long rest.

entries.name: Meld
entries: When you take a short or long rest in the presence of one or more other myconids, you can meld with them. After melding, you regain all expended Hit Dice and gain one of the following benefits:
• You gain advantage on the next saving throw you make.
• You can end one effect causing you to be {@condition Blinded}, {@condition Deafened}, {@condition Paralyzed}, or {@condition Poisoned}.
• You can roll an additional 1d4 and add the number rolled to one ability check or attack roll you make.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can read and write Common and one extra language of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: Sacara mature at the same rate as humans and live for up to 200 years. Female Sacara shed their young tails at age 15 in order to grow into their adult tails, and all Sacara from 20 and onwards shed every 5 years, maintaining their ageless youth.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Sacara have a tendency to the neutral and evil spectrum of the alignment tree, as their society is largely built around the principle of individual strength, so concepts like good seminarianism are less prominent. Their scheming nature incline many Sacara toward a lawful alignment.

entries.name: Size
entries: Sacara maintain the same size and build as humans, although female Sacara manifest a serpentine body from the navel down. Their snake-like tails can extend anywhere from 5 to 9 feet long. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Viper's Resilience
entries: You have resistance to poison damage.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Due to your bestial nature, you have superior vision in dark and dim lit places. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in the darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in the darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Paralyzing Gaze
entries: Once you reach 5th level, you learn the spell {@spell hold person}. You can cast this spell once per long rest, as your paralyzing schlera are scratched and need time to regenerate. Intelligence is your spellcasting modifier for this spell.
